task: Identify a Specialization on Coursera that teaches C++ programming for beginners, provide the name and what the learning outcomes are.
user_action_and_explanation: type "C++ programming for beginners specialization" in the search bar to find courses or specializations that teach C++ programming for beginners. The search bar's placeholder text is 'What do you want to learn?', and this action will help locate relevant educational programs quickly.
observation: Several specializations related to C++ programming for beginners have been found. Notably, the "Coding for Everyone: C and C++" by the University of California, Santa Cruz is a beginner specialization that spans 3-6 months. The learning outcomes include skills in C Programming Language Family, Computer Programming, Programming Principles, Algorithms, Data Structures, C++ Programming, and Computational Logic. Another course is "Programming in C++: A Hands-on Introduction" by Codio, also a beginner specialization lasting 3-6 months, focusing on Computer Programming, Computer Science, and Problem Solving.
